APPENDIX G
APPENDIX H
         Critical Crash Rate Method Worksheet

                      US 25 (Merrimon Avenue) at Broad Street

Given:

       Crashes                      11

         ADT                       21,250         vpd

       Beg MP                        0
                                                                 0.1136         miles
       End MP                      0.1136

      Beg Date                 July 1, 2007
                                                                   3.00         years
      End Date                June 30, 2010

          Fa                       468.47         crashes per 100mvmt

           k                       3.291




Solve:

          M                   0.232902816         100mvmt

 Critical Crash Rate =             618.22         crashes per 100mvmt


   Total Crash Rate =              47.23          crashes per 100mvmt




Fc = Fa + k(Fa / M)1/2 + 1 / 2*M

Where:
Fc = the critical crash rate
Fa = the statewide crash rate of roadway class or average crash rate
k = a probability constant
M = vehicle exposure (100mvmt)


                         k = 1.645 for a 95% confidence level, rural areas
                         k = 3.291 for a 99.95% confidence level, urban areas
    Critical Crash Rate Method Worksheet




Input Total Crash Rate from Strip Analysis Report =     47.23



                                  Days per Year =     3216.0013

         Critical Crash Rate Method Worksheet

                    US 25 (Merrimon Avenue) at Chestnut Street

Given:

       Crashes                      27

         ADT                       23,000         vpd

       Beg MP                        0
                                                                 0.1136         miles
       End MP                      0.1136

      Beg Date                 July 1, 2007
                                                                   3.00         years
      End Date                June 30, 2010

          Fa                       468.47         crashes per 100mvmt

           k                       3.291




Solve:

          M                   0.252077304         100mvmt

 Critical Crash Rate =             612.33         crashes per 100mvmt


   Total Crash Rate =              107.11         crashes per 100mvmt




Fc = Fa + k(Fa / M)1/2 + 1 / 2*M

Where:
Fc = the critical crash rate
Fa = the statewide crash rate of roadway class or average crash rate
k = a probability constant
M = vehicle exposure (100mvmt)


                         k = 1.645 for a 95% confidence level, rural areas
                         k = 3.291 for a 99.95% confidence level, urban areas
    Critical Crash Rate Method Worksheet

1 = RAN OFF ROAD - RIGHT                                   1 = BRIDGE
2 = RAN OFF ROAD - LEFT                                    2 = BRIDGE APPROACH
3 = RAN OFF ROAD - STRAIGHT                                3 = UNDERPASS

18 = MOVABLE OBJECT                                        11 = FIVE-POINT, OR MORE
19 = FIXED OBJECT                                          12 = RELATED TO INTERSECTION
20 = PARKED MOTOR VEHICLE                                  13 = NON-INTERSECTION MEDIAN CROSSING
21 = REAR END, SLOW OR STOP                                14 = END OR BEGINNING - DIVIDED HIGHWAY
22 = REAR END, TURN                                        15 = OFF RAMP ENTRY
23 = LEFT TURN, SAME ROADWAY                               16 = OFF RAMP PROPER

26 = RIGHT TURN, DIFFERENT ROADWAYS                        19 = ON RAMP ENTRY
27 = HEAD ON                                               20 = ON RAMP PROPER
28 = SIDESWIPE, SAME DIRECTION                             21 = ON RAMP TERMINAL ON CROSSROAD
29 = SIDESWIPE, OPPOSITE DIRECTION                         22 = RAILROAD CROSSING
30 = ANGLE                                                 23 = TUNNEL
31 = BACKING UP                                            24 = SHARED-USE PATHS OR TRAILS
32 = OTHER COLLISION WITH VEHICLE                          25 = OTHER

1 = DRY                              1 = DAYLIGHT                      1 = CLEAR
2 = WET                              2 = DUSK                          2 = CLOUDY
3 = WATER (STANDING, MOVING)         3 = DAWN                          3 = RAIN
4 = ICE                              4 = DARK - LIGHTED ROADWAY        4 = SNOW
5 = SNOW                             5 = DARK - ROADWAY NOT LIGHTED    5 = FOG, SMOG, SMOKE
6 = SLUSH                            6 = DARK - UNKNOWN LIGHTING       6 = SLEET, HAIL, FREEZING RAIN/DRIZZLE
7 = SAND, MUD, DIRT, GRAVEL          7 = OTHER                         7 = SEVERE CROSSWINDS
8 = FUEL, OIL                        8 = UNKNOWN                       8 = BLOWING SAND, DIRT, SNOW
9 = OTHER                                                              9 = OTHER
10 = UNKNOWN

K = FATAL                            2 = STRAIGHT, HILLCREST           2 = NO

Veh Mnvr - Vehicle Maneuver Codes          Dv - Traffic Control Device

14 = LEAVING PARKED POSITION               13 = DOUBLE YELLOW LINE, NO PASSING ZONE

Alchl/Drgs - Driver Alcohol/Drugs Suspected Status Codes
0 = NO
1 = YES - ALCOHOL, IMPAIRMENT SUSPECTED
2 = YES - ALCOHOL, NO IMPAIRMENT DETECTED
3 = YES - OTHER DRUGS, IMPAIRMENT SUSPECTED
4 = YES - OTHER DRUGS, NO IMPAIRMENT DETECTED
5 = YES - ALCOHOL AND OTHER DRUGS, IMPAIRMENT SUSPECTED
6 = YES - ALCOHOL AND OTHER DRUGS, NO IMPAIRMENT DETECTED
7 = UNKNOWN

Ped Actn - Pedestrian Action Codes                       Ci - Roadway Contributing Circumstances
1 = ENTERING OR CROSSING SPECIFIED LOCATION              0 = NONE (NO UNUSUAL CONDITIONS)
2 = WALKING, RIDING, RUNNING/JOGGING WITH TRAFFIC        1 = ROAD SURFACE CONDITION
3 = WALKING, RIDING, RUNNING/JOGGING AGAINST TRAFFIC     2 = DEBRIS
4 = WORKING                                              3 = RUT, HOLES, BUMPS
5 = PUSHING VEHICLE                                      4 = WORK ZONE (CONSTRUCTION, MAINTENANCE,
6 = APPROACHING OR LEAVING VEHICLE                       UTILITY)
7 = PLAYING                                              5 = WORN TRAVEL-POLISHED SURFACE
8 = STANDING                                             6 = OBSTRUCTION IN ROADWAY
9 = OTHER                                                7 = TRAFFIC CONTROL DEVICE INOPERATIVE, NOT
                                                         VISIBLE OR MISSING

                       Fiche, Intersection, and Strip Reports Code Index

15 = PEDALCYCLIST                                  2 = PICKUP
17 = ANIMAL                                        3 = LIGHT TRUCK (MINI-VAN, PANEL)
18 = MOVABLE OBJECT                                4 = SPORT UTILITY
20 = PARKED MOTOR VEHICLE                          5 = VAN
33 = TREE                                          6 = COMMERCIAL BUS
34 = UTILITY POLE                                  7 = SCHOOL BUS
35 = LUMINAIRE POLE NON-BREAKAWAY                  8 = ACTIVITY BUS
36 = LUMINAIRE POLE BREAKAWAY                      9 = OTHER BUS
